Character / Name / Given Name.Name: Given Name
Character / Name / Given Name.Description: Given and family names can be used independently as standalone names. In many cases you can reverse the order.

Character / Name / Callsign.Name: Callsign
Character / Name / Callsign.Description: Spacers are often known only by their callsigns, with their dirtside names reserved for family and close friends.

Character / Name / Family Name.Name: Family Name
Character / Name / Family Name.Description: Given and family names can be used independently as standalone names. In many cases you can reverse the order.

Table.Result: Dreadful scene of death or violence
Encounter with a friendly survivor, explorer, or denizen
Opening to outmaneuver or escape a threat or foe
Distressing signs of mass violence or death
Haunting vision of life here before the fall
Secure area offers a moment of peace
Terminal with access to site details
Failing equipment requires a specific part or skill
Shrouded atmosphere conceals a lurking foe
Chance to restore power or function
Recorded message reveals helpful aspects of this site
Coded message or puzzling security device
Discouraging evidence of failed plans or defenses
Displays reveal a new threat elsewhere in this site
Sensors indicate the arrival of an external threat
Log offers insight into this site's downfall
Secure area offers a moment of peace
Rivals seek to secure these resources
Signs of an unearthed or manufactured threat
Disturbing outcome of a failed experiment
Fragile vault holds a dire threat

Location Theme / Chaotic / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Chaotic / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Alterations in the flow of time
Corrupted or warped architecture or terrain
Corrupted or warped environment or ecosystem
Cryptic device harnesses or powers chaos
Lifeforms mutated or altered by chaos
Visions of your past or future

Location Theme / Chaotic / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Chaotic / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: Chaos makes its mark upon you
Chaotic energies block the path or assail you
Disorienting changes in time or location
Dreadful scene of those who fell prey to chaos
Equipment is made unstable or dangerous

Location Theme / Chaotic / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Chaotic / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Table.Result: Chaos ebbs or withdraws for a time
Chaos empowers you with strange but useful abilities
Chaos manifests as comforting or inspiring visions
Insight into the source or nature of the chaos

Location Theme / Fortified / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Fortified / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Enemy forces assembled for an event
Enemy forces off-duty or at leisure
Enemy forces transporting supplies or equipment

Location Theme / Fortified / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Fortified / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: Automated security or weapons target you
Checkpoint or path with restricted access
Enemies reveal new capabilities or technology
Enemies trick you or lure you into a trap
Problematic alliance or affiliations is revealed
Revealed schemes of an enemy leader create new urgency
Your plan is undone by an unexpected complication

Location Theme / Fortified / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Fortified / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Table.Result: Insight into the plans or methods of the enemy force
Opening to get the drop on an enemy
Opening to outmaneuver or escape enemies
Potential collaborator or informant reveals themselves
Access to useful equipment or weapons

Location Theme / Haunted / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Haunted / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Ghostly visions of this place in another time
Objects move of their own accord
Twisted or altered architecture or terrain

Location Theme / Haunted / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Haunted / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: Assailed by an angry or vengeful being
Beguiling illusions tempt you to linger or stay
Equipment is plagued by unexplainable malfunctions
Plunged into disorienting darkness or illusionary surroundings
Spirits or undead reveal surprising abilities or motivations
Sudden, shocking reveal of a ghostly manifestation or undead form
Visions reveal a horrifying aspect of this place

Location Theme / Haunted / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Haunted / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Table.Result: Encounter with a benign spirit or being
Message or clue leads offers insight into the nature of this haunting
Secret area or path is revealed
Useful or interesting artifact or device

Location Theme / Infested / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Infested / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Remains of a creature or remnants of a previous form
Trail or evidence of a creature's passage

Location Theme / Infested / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Infested / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: Creatures guided or controlled by a greater threat
Creatures reveal new aspects or abilities
Creatures take or destroy something important
Discovery of a live but threatened victim
Lured or driven into a trap or dead-end
Powerful or dominant creature reveals itself

Location Theme / Infested / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Infested / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Table.Result: Clue to the nature or vulnerabilities of these creatures
Early warning of an attack or ambush
External event provides a helpful distraction

Location Theme / Inhabited / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Inhabited / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Display or monument honors a notable cultural event
Emergency teams responding to an incident or crisis
Notable figure stands out from the crowd
Vendor or merchant hawking their wares

Location Theme / Inhabited / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Inhabited / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: Announcement or notification brings harrowing news
Arrival of a foe or rival
Blockade or security cordon cuts off needed access
Caught in the crossfire of a dispute
Signs of disease, infestation, or toxic environment
Signs that you are being watched or followed
Unwanted attention from authority or enemies

Location Theme / Inhabited / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Inhabited / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Table.Result: Intriguing offer from an unexpected source
Lively festival or gathering place provides a chance to socialize
Local gossip proves interesting or helpful
Needed item, resource, or buyer is available

Location Theme / Ruined / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Ruined / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Collapsed or broken structures or terrain
Device or artifact with residual power or function
Focal point or nexus of the destruction
Innermost or hidden spaces laid bare by the destruction
Message or recording from before the fall
Sad memento of a lost life
Sights or sounds of structural instability
Survivors or guardians dwell among the ruins

Location Theme / Ruined / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Ruined / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: Dreadful atmosphere of loss and destruction weighs upon you
Evidence of a horrible fate for others who passed this way
Hostile creature has staked out their territory
Lured into a trap or targeted by automated defenses
Source of the destruction persists or returns anew

Location Theme / Ruined / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Ruined / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Table.Result: Access to an untouched or preserved area
Insight into what brought this place to ruin
Interesting or useful device or artifact
Shortcut or passage through the destruction

Location Theme / Sacred / Feature.Name: Feature
Location Theme / Sacred / Feature.Description: Use this table to reveal a new aspect of the location.

Table.Result: Adherents performing worship or enacting rituals
Graves or remains of glorified disciples
Protected reliquary of an artifact or token
Subtle manifestations of mystical power or visions
Tokens or motifs representing the faith's domain

Location Theme / Sacred / Peril.Name: Peril
Location Theme / Sacred / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication or hazard.

Table.Result: An aspect of the faith beguiles you or lures you into danger
Dreadful aspects or powers of the faith are revealed
Embodiment of a god or power is given corrupted form or purpose
Guardians seek martyrdom in defense of this place
Leaders corrupt or exploit their followers to oppose you
Protective ward or enigmatic puzzle blocks the way
Unnatural corruption or decay fouls the environment
Zealots enact a ceremony to unlock forbidden powers

Location Theme / Sacred / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Location Theme / Sacred / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a beneficial encounter or event, such as when rolling a strong hit with a match in a location.

Encounter with a helpful adherent or heretic

Worrying arrival of a ship or vehicle

Table.Summary: This planet is airless, or it's atmosphere is so thin as to be useless for humans.
This planet's atmosphere is not compatible with human life. Exploring this place will require a sealed environment or breathing apparatus. Otherwise, survival is measured in minutes.
This planet's atmosphere is deadly to humans. As a bonus, it can damage exposed skin, materials, plastics, and metals over time.
It's unhealthy to breathe this planet's atmosphere for more than a few hours at a time.
This atmosphere is not perfect, but it's good enough to sustain human life.
This planet's atmosphere is ideally suited to human life. It's literally a breath of fresh air.

Precursor Vault / Interior / First Look.Name: First Look
Precursor Vault / Interior / First Look.Description: Use this table to reveal what you see or encounter when first entering the site. These aspects, combined with the exterior features, will help you envision the nature and condition of the vault and provide context for the rest of your exploration.

Table.Result: Reactive lighting responds to your presence
Elevated path over chasm or shaft
Inscrutable object lies dark and silent
Signs of an attack or battle

Precursor Vault / Interior / Peril.Name: Peril
Precursor Vault / Interior / Peril.Description: Use this table to help envision a complication within a vault, such as when you [Explore a Waypoint](#Explore-a-Waypoint) and are prompted to envision a peril.

Table.Result: Dire warning left by other explorers
Hazardous path designed for traversal by other beings
Tempting location or object holds hidden dangers

Precursor Vault / Interior / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Precursor Vault / Interior / Opportunity.Description: Use this table to help envision a favorable circumstance within a vault, such as when you [Explore a Waypoint](#Explore-a-Waypoint) and are prompted to envision an opportunity.

Table.Result: Clue points the way to your destination or target
Clue to a lifeform's nature or vulnerabilities
Helpful gear left by another explorer
Insight into the nature or history of this site
Opening to get the drop on a foe
Opening to outmaneuver or escape a threat or foe
Secure area offers a moment of peace
Shortcut or less perilous path speeds your way

Precursor Vault / Sanctum / Purpose.Name: Purpose
Precursor Vault / Sanctum / Purpose.Description: Because precursor vaults are alien and enigmatic, understanding their ultimate purpose requires investigation and exploration. Use this table to reveal the vaults original function or role at an appropriate point in your survey. This can come as an outcome of completing an expedition, or when your story naturally leads you to a revelation of the sites nature.

Table.Result: Capture or control of other beings
Preservation of maps or navigational data
Safekeeping of cultural records or memories
Surveying or monitoring of a location
Worship of a god or being
Central chamber of immense proportions or grandeur
Incongruent space contradicts the nature of this site
Inscrutable object emits sound and energy
Pockets or layers of altered atmosphere
Pods or chambers with preserved corpses
Surfaces covered in slime or fungus
Visions of this place in another time
Visions or reflections of another reality
Camouflaged or transforming foe reveals itself
Horrifying fate for a previous intruder
Led astray or lured into danger by a manifestation or illusion
Lost the way or separated from others
Manifestations prey upon your weaknesses or worries
Other intruders have been corrupted or mutated by this place
Scene of hideous violence or death
Spawning or swarming foes surround you
Temptations to linger or remain in this site
You are marked by physical corruption or mutation
Access to a secret or protected area
Clue points the way to your destination or target
Control or terminal adjusts to accept your input
Deeper insight into the history or nature of this site
Device or artifact reveals its purpose
Environment adjusts to better suit you
Foes stand down or give way
Key offers control of a function or aspect of this site
Shortcut or less perilous path speeds your way
Comet with a tail of ionized gas
Comet with a tail of ionized gas
Comet with a tail of ionized gas

Space / Sector Name / Prefix.Name: Prefix
Space / Sector Name / Prefix.Description: To give a sector or region of space a random name, roll once for the first word and once for the second word. Or just roll once choose a suitable pairing from anywhere in that row.

Space / Sector Name / Suffix.Name: Suffix
Space / Sector Name / Suffix.Description: To give a sector or region of space a random name, roll once for the first word and once for the second word. Or just roll once choose a suitable pairing from anywhere in that row.

Character Creation / Background Assets.Name: Background Assets
Character Creation / Background Assets.Description: If you want some direction for your starting paths, roll or pick from the table below and take the two paths associated with your selected background.

Table.Summary: HEALER, VETERAN
BANNERSWORN, DIPLOMAT
ARCHIVIST, NATURALIST
NAVIGATOR, TRADER
ARMORED, BOUNTY HUNTER
AGENT, TECH
ACE, NAVIGATOR
EXPLORER, VOIDBORN
GUNNER, SLAYER
OUTCAST, SHADE
AGENT, BLADEMASTER
FUGITIVE, GUNSLINGER
BRAWLER, SLEUTH
DEVOTANT, SEER
KINETIC, VESTIGE
COURIER, SCOUNDREL
HAUNTED, EMPATH
GEARHEAD, TECH
AUGMENTED, MERCENARY
SCAVENGER, SCOUNDREL

Character Creation / Backstory Prompts.Name: Backstory Prompts
Character Creation / Backstory Prompts.Description: For some backstory inspiration, roll or pick from the table below. Then, take a moment to elaborate on the suggestion. Or just leave it a bit vague and mysterious for now; you can flesh it out in play.

Table.Result: You abandoned your kin after learning a troubling truth
You are guided by a vision or prophesy
You are haunted by past actions or failures
You are running from a criminal past
You are the sole survivor of an attack or calamity
You escaped an abusive or unjust situation
You have no memory of your former life
You rejected a duty or destiny
You were cast out of your former home
You were on your own for as long as you can remember
You were taken or lured away by someone
Your ambitions outgrew your humble origins
Your wanderlust carried you far away

Character Creation / Starship History.Name: Starship History
Character Creation / Starship History.Description: Envision how you obtained or earned this ship. You can come up with your own origin, or roll or pick from the table below. If you use a result from the table, take a moment to consider and elaborate on the suggestion.

Table.Result: Acquired in trade for a precious family heirloom
Discovered as a derelict, and patched back together
Earned in exchange for a promise or vow
Granted by an organization or community
Inherited from a relative or mentor
Purchased at a suspiciously cheap price
Stolen from a notorious crime boss or criminal organization
Taken while fleeing an attack or disaster

Character Creation / Starship Quirks.Name: Starship Quirks
Character Creation / Starship Quirks.Description: Your ship is an important aspect of your characterand a character in its own right. What does it look like? What makes it interesting or uniquely yours? Does it have any particular quirks? If nothing occurs to you now, you can flesh it out in play, or roll once or twice on the table below.

Table.Result: Engine room is scorched with old burn marks
Exterior is marred by rust and grime
Faint, phantom music sometimes echoes through the corridors
Hull is fused with organic growths
Hull rattles and groans in atmospheric flight
Interior spaces are crowded with exposed cables and conduits
Looks defenseless, but exterior panels open to reveal weapons
Navigation logs contain coordinates to locations that do notor should notexist
Old bloodstain in the airlock reappears even when painted over
Once a beautiful ship, now scarred by a devastating battle
Patched hull covers a recent catastrophic breach
Placards and control labels are in an uncommon language
Removable plate decks provide access to hidden storage
Segmented landing gear unfold like gangly spider legs
Ship is powered by an ancient precursor device
Someone marked the hull with graffiti during a recent layover
Strange symbols are scrawled on the deck and bulkheads in the main corridor
Things tend to go missing for no logical reason
Timers and clocks are always just a bit off
Blockade prevents trade with other sectors
Bounty hunters search for an infamous fugitive
Chaotic breaches in spacetime spread like wildfire
Devastating superweapon has fallen into the wrong hands
Newly found resource lures greedy fortune hunters to the sector
Notorious pirate clan preys on starships
Parasitic lifeforms spread like a plague
Precursor sites throughout the sector emit strange signals
Prophecies foretell an imminent awakening of a dreadful power
Raider clan emerges as a dominant threat under a new leader
Rogue AI infiltrates systems throughout the sector
Settlements or factions are on the brink of war
Sickness spreads among ships and settlements
Titanic spaceborne lifeform stalks the spaceways
Aid a starship caught in a spacetime fracture
Broker peace between two feuding settlements
Chart a new passage between isolated settlements
Defend the people of a beleaguered settlement against raiders
Discover who sabotaged a settlement's air processors
Escort a tradeship carrying a prized cargo
Ferry a rescue team to a perilous disaster site
Infiltrate a fortified base to steal crucial data
Investigate terrifying manifestations at a remote settlement
Liberate prisoners at a cruel labor camp
Locate a downed spacer on an uninhabited planet
Protect a fugitive from a relentless bounty hunter
Recover a cherished pre-exodus artifact from an enemy
Rescue a starship crew held captive by mutineers
Retrieve a cache of stolen weapons from a pirate ship
Search for a missing expedition in the depths of a precursor vault
Shield a wondrous lifeform from those who seek to destroy it
Track and slay a marauding beast
Transport a displaced people to their new home

Core / Action.Name: Action
Core / Action.Description:
Use these oracle tables to reveal details about a goal, situation, or event. They provide a word or phrase that can be taken literally or interpreted as an abstraction.

Action and Theme can answer questions such as:

  * What does this character want?
  * What is this factions mission?
  * What caused the downfall of this settlement?
  * What is this devices purpose?

Core / Theme.Name: Theme
Core / Theme.Description:
Use these oracle tables to reveal details about a goal, situation, or event. They provide a word or phrase that can be taken literally or interpreted as an abstraction.

Action and Theme can answer questions such as:

  * What does this character want?
  * What is this factions mission?
  * What caused the downfall of this settlement?
  * What is this devices purpose?

Core / Descriptor.Name: Descriptor
Core / Descriptor.Description:
Use these oracles to generate the details of a location, discovery, or encounter. The Descriptor oracle is particularly handy for quick generation of a location. For example, use it to describe the basic nature of a planet instead of rolling on the detailed planet oracles.

Descriptor and Focus can answer questions such as:

  * What is this ships cargo?
  * What is the nature of this planet?
  * What is inside this station?
  * What hazard do I encounter?

Core / Focus.Name: Focus
Core / Focus.Description:
Use these oracles to generate the details of a location, discovery, or encounter. The Descriptor oracle is particularly handy for quick generation of a location. For example, use it to describe the basic nature of a planet instead of rolling on the detailed planet oracles.

Descriptor and Focus can answer questions such as:

  * What is this ships cargo?
  * What is the nature of this planet?
  * What is inside this station?
  * What hazard do I encounter?

Creature / Environment.Name: Environment
Creature / Environment.Description: Choose the closest match for your location. Or roll to identify the primary habitat of a creature.

Table.Summary: bug-sized
rodent-sized
dog-sized
person-sized
vehicle-sized
whale-sized
hill-sized
mountain-sized
planet-sized

Creature / First Look.Name: First Look
Creature / First Look.Description: Roll for a basic form, and flesh out the creatures appearance using the First Look table.

Creature / Encountered Behavior.Name: Encountered Behavior
Creature / Encountered Behavior.Description: Roll once on the Encountered Behavior table to define this creatures motivation and frame how the encounter begins.

Creature / Revealed Aspect.Name: Revealed Aspect
Creature / Revealed Aspect.Description: Roll on this table as you interact with the creature to introduce new features or behaviors. Some results may contradict the established nature of a creature. For example, an amorphous creature which you envisioned as a mass of pure energy would not have typical physical features. If a result doesnt fit, feel free to ignore, reroll, or adjust. Or simply envision how this contradiction signals a new understanding or unexpected transformation.

Table.Summary: Banished or forgotten
Limited influence in a remote location
Marginal influence in a single sector
Strong influence in a single sector
Dispersed influence across a few sectors
Far-reaching influence across many sectors
Pervasive influence across inhabited space

Faction / Projects.Name: Projects
Faction / Projects.Description: Pick or roll on this table to reveal the current focus of a faction. Then, use the nature of the organization to help envision the meaning of the project. The result may introduce events which motivate your character to aid or resist the project, or can simply serve as background detail for your setting. If you would like to track the factions progress, set a clock for the project using the campaign clock guidelines on page 229.

Table.Result: Broaden scope of the faction to include a new focus
Build or secure a powerful device
Consolidate control of a valuable commodity
Disrupt the operations of a rival
Escape the control of another faction or power
Establish a safe refuge or headquarters
Expand operations to a new location or sector
Obtain incriminating information about a rival
Put down an internal revolt or rebellion
Rescue or recover a group or asset
Resolve a conflict with another faction
Reunite splintered elements of the faction
Seize a powerful artifact or valuable treasure
Usurp leadership within a rival faction

Faction / Relationships.Name: Relationships
Faction / Relationships.Description: Factions can add scale and narrative opportunities to your setting. But keep it manageable. Dont overload your campaign with factions. Instead, focus on your interactions and entanglements with members of a few interesting factions. Then, when you have a question about the relationship of one faction to another, use this table. The result is the commonly understood connection between those factions. Further investigations or events may reveal a deeper or alternate truth.

Faction / Name Template.Name: Name Template
Faction / Name Template.Description:
To generate a faction name, first roll or choose the name template. Then, follow the structure of the template to build the name from individual tables. If youve already set the faction type, picking from the tables (instead of rolling) will likely provide a more appropriate result. For example, Silver Jackals is a fitting name for a criminal organization. The Empire of the Undying Suns is a less apt name for that gangunless their leader is prone to delusions of grandeur. In short, choosing a name will give you more control. Rolling might give you a result that doesnt square with known aspects, but those contradictions may prove inspiring.

An alternative approach to generate a faction from scratch is to start with a random name. Then, consider what the name evokes and choose an appropriate faction type instead of rolling on those tables. For example, Bloody Ravens might suggest a mercenary guild, while the Republic of the Radiant Servants brings to mind a dominion built upon a religion, or one which idolizes a prophesied leader. If a result doesnt inspire anything interesting, roll again or simply pick.

Faction / Quirks.Name: Quirks
Faction / Quirks.Description: Roll or pick known characteristics of the faction and its members using this table. But keep in mind that even within a small or specialized faction, there are no absolutes. These quirks represent common attitudes, practices, or approaches, but are not universal to every member of that faction. Leave room in your portrayal for diversity and contradictions.

Table.Result: Animal or creature motif used as a faction symbol
Body augmentations are respected and valued
Body ornamentations signify castes or roles
Elite soldiers provide defense or serve as bodyguards
Honors the fallen through unusual death rites
Idolizes a long-dead founder or martyr
Members take a new name when joining the faction
Operates under strict codes or laws
Recognizes others through a distinctive greeting or gesture
Starships share a distinctive and recognizable profile
Symbiotic relationship with a specific creature
Trains in a demanding physical discipline or martial art
Wields unnatural abilities or strange technologies

Faction / Rumors.Name: Rumors
Faction / Rumors.Description: Use this table when you are in a position to investigate a faction by uncovering secrets or fishing for gossip.

Table.Result: Caught in the crossfire of feuding factions
Critical resource is in short supply
Digital systems are corrupted or infiltrated
Hit hard by a recent attack or calamity
Holds incriminating information against a leader or faction
Knows the location of a fabled treasure or lost technology
Leaders are haunted by a dark prophecy
Leaders are puppets of another power or faction
Lesser members of the leadership are plotting a coup
New belief or religion is creating a schism among members
Operations are a false front for their true purpose
Overdependence on a failing or vulnerable technology
Plagued by infighting and low morale
Plotting to betray an allied faction
Preparing a major offensive or operation
Pulling the strings of a leader or faction
Sheltering an infamous or dangerous fugitive
Suffering a shortage of key workers or personnel
Uprising or revolt is brewing from within

Location Theme / Theme Type.Name: Theme Type
Location Theme / Theme Type.Description: You will typically choose a theme which supports what you know of that locations nature. If you want a random theme, roll on the table above.

Table.Summary: Reality is corrupted or warped in this place.
Enemies defend this place against intruders.
Restless spirits are bound to this place.
Foul creatures have overrun this place.
People have built a community in this place.
Time, disaster, or war have ravaged this place.
The faithful worship inscrutable powers in this place.

Miscellaneous / Story Complication.Name: Story Complication
Miscellaneous / Story Complication.Description: This oracle will introduce narrative turns, troubles, and revelations. It can be used as an alternative to the Pay the Price table when you encounter a negative outcome at a crucial moment. In particular, you might use this table after rolling matched 10s on the challenge dice.

Table.Result: Crucial equipment or device is sabotaged
Enemy reveals unexpected powers, abilities, or influence
Enemy reveals their true agenda or nature
Enemy unexpectedly benefits from your actions
Key location is threatened or made unsafe
Needed item or resource is unavailable
Object of a quest is not what you assumed
Simultaneous problems force a hard choice
Someone important is threatened or endangered
Someone important reveals their problematic secret or history
Technology or device is shown to have unexpected effects
True agenda of a connection or patron is revealed
Trusted information is shown to be false
Two seemingly unrelated problems are shown to be connected
Urgent message distracts you from your quest
You were diverted from the true crisis

Miscellaneous / Combat Action.Name: Combat Action
Miscellaneous / Combat Action.Description: Use this oracle to help inspire an action for a foe in a fight. When youre not sure what an enemy does next, particularly when they have you in a bad spot, roll on this table and interpret the result as appropriate to the nature of the enemy and your objective.

Table.Result: Block a path or cut off an objective
Destroy something or render it useless
Leverage the advantage of a weapon or ability
Make a cautious or probing attack
Make a ferocious or powerful attack
Make a precise or careful attack
Nullify a system, device, or weapon
Shift the fight to a new area
Use an unexpected weapon or ability

Miscellaneous / Anomaly Effect.Name: Anomaly Effect
Miscellaneous / Anomaly Effect.Description: Meddling with alien artifacts or forbidden magic may put you at the mercy of chaos. Use this table to resolve the effects of ancient tech, rituals, or other strange forces. Results on this table may have devastating implications, so use it only in rare and dramatic moments.

Table.Result: Causes rapid biological growth or infestation
Corrupts or infects devices or computers
Decays or weakens surrounding terrain or structures
Drains energy from equipment or devices
Generates tendrils of energy which slither or grasp
Nullifies or destroys equipment or devices
Opens a path to another location
Reveals glimpses of the distant past
Reveals glimpses of the far future
Reverses time by a few moments or minutes
Summons or manifests an ancient being or intelligence
Flashback reveals an aspect of your background or nature
Flashback reveals an aspect of another character, place, or faction
Influential character or faction is introduced or given new detail
Seemingly unrelated situations are shown to be connected
External factors create new danger, urgency, or importance for a quest
Important character is put in danger or suffers a misadventure
Key location is made unsafe or becomes mired in conflict
Unexpected return of an enemy or threat
Peril lies ahead or lurks just out of view
Unforeseen aid is on the way or within reach
Advanced technology waiting to be harnessed or salvaged
Artificial consciousness evolved to a higher state
Clues to a crucial resource or uncharted domain
Envoy from another time or reality
Gateway to another time or alternate reality
Key to unlocking a language or method of communication
Monumental architecture or artistry of an ancient civilization
Mysterious device or artifact of potential value
New understanding of an enduring mystery
Pathway or means of travel to a distant location
Person or lifeform with phenomenal abilities
Visions or prophesies of the future
Horde of insatiable hunger or fury
Messenger or signal with a dire warning
Passage to a grim alternate reality
Powerful distortions of time or space
Vault of dread technology or power
Worshipers of great and malevolent powers
Its worse than you thought: Make a suffer move (-2)
Victory is short-lived: A new peril or foe appears
You face collateral damage: Something is lost, damaged, or broken
Others pay the price: Someone else suffers the cost
Others wont forget: You are marked for vengeance
It gets complicated: The true nature of a foe or objective is revealed
You are dying. Within an hour or two, you must [Heal](#Heal) and raise your health above 0, or [Face Death](#Face-Death).
You are unconscious and out of action. If left alone, you come back to your senses in an hour or two. If you are vulnerable to ongoing harm, [Face Death](#Face-Death).
You are reeling and fighting to stay conscious. If you engage in any vigorous activity before taking a breather for a few minutes, roll on this table again (before resolving the other move).
You give in to fear or compulsion, and act against your better instincts.
Immediate catastrophic destruction. All aboard must [Endure Harm](#Endure-Harm) or [Face Death](#Face-Death), as appropriate.
Destruction is imminent and unavoidable. If you do not have the means or intention to get clear, [Endure Harm](#Endure-Harm) or [Face Death](#Face-Death) as appropriate.
Destruction is imminent, but can be averted if you [Repair](#Repair) your vehicle and raise its integrity above 0. If you fail, see 11-25.
You cannot [Repair](#Repair) this vehicle until you [Resupply](#Resupply) and obtain a crucial replacement part. If you roll this result again prior to that, see 11-25.
The vehicle is crippled or out of your control. To get it back in action, you must [Repair](#Repair) and raise its integrity above 0.
It's a rough ride. All aboard must make the [Endure Harm](#Endure-Harm), [Endure Stress](#Endure-Stress), or [Companion Takes a Hit](#Companion-Takes-a-Hit) move, suffering a serious (-2) cost.
Youve lost fuel, energy, or cargo. [Sacrifice Resources](#Sacrifice-Resources) (-2).
Against all odds, the vehicle holds together.
A trusted individual or community acts against you
An individual or community you care about is exposed to danger
You encounter signs of a looming threat
You create an opportunity for an enemy
You face the consequences of an earlier choice
A surprising development complicates your quest
You are separated from something or someone
Your action causes collateral damage or has an unintended effect
Something of value is lost or destroyed
The environment or terrain introduces a new hazard
A friend, companion, or ally is in harms way (or you are, if alone)
You are delayed or put at a disadvantage

Planet / Planetary Class.Name: Planetary Class
Planet / Planetary Class.Description: This oracle provides a simple method of generating a planetary class. If this is enough information, stop there and envision the world as appropriate to its type. For a bit more detail, make a roll on the Descriptor oracle and envision how that aspect defines the nature of the planet or a specific planetside location.

Table.Summary: A pitiless planet of searing heat, blowing sand, and sunbaked rock.
A planet with relentless volcanic activity, wreathed in fire and ash.
A once-thriving worldnow a grim monument to a fallen civilization.
A rugged, frozen worldlocked in an unending winter.
A massive planet with vast layers of dense gases surrounding a small rocky core.
A humid, rain-soaked planet which keeps its secrets under a thick canopy of vegetation.
A planet completely or mostly covered by a boundless ocean.
A rugged planet scarred by eons of destructive asteroid impacts.
A planet sundered by cataclysmic destruction.
A foul planet wracked by a poisonous climate and virulent growths.
This diverse, life-bearing planet might provide some small measure of hope.

Table.Result: Phasing in and out of reality

Settlement / Projects.Name: Projects
Settlement / Projects.Description: Check the Settlement Projects table when its appropriate for your character to know or uncover these details. Projects are the main industry, function, or focus of a settlement. They do not necessarily represent every activity at the siteparticularly at a large settlementbut are the most visible or noteworthy aspects.

Settlement / Trouble.Name: Trouble
Settlement / Trouble.Description: Check the Settlement Trouble table when its appropriate for your character to know or uncover these details. The Settlement Trouble table provides a broad description of the sites most dramatic current issue.

Settlement / Name.Name: Name
Settlement / Name.Description: Choose a name appropriate to the nature of the settlement, or roll for a random result. You can let the name stand alone, or pair it with one of the following tags: Base, Citadel, Depot, Fortress, Hold, Landing, Outpost, Port, Station, Terminal.

Space / Stellar Object.Name: Stellar Object
Space / Stellar Object.Description: Use the Stellar Object oracle to learn more about the primary star at a location. This is mostly to help you visualize your surroundings, but the strange or hazardous nature of some rare stars can incite new adventures.

Table.Result: Young star incubating in a molecular cloud
White dwarf shining with spectral light
Corrupted star radiating with unnatural light
Neutron star surrounded by intense magnetic fields
Two stars in close orbit connected by fiery tendrils of energy
Black hole allows nothing to escapenot even light
Hypergiant star generating turbulent solar winds
Artificial star constructed by a long-dead civilization
Unstable star showing signs of impending supernova

Space / Peril.Name: Peril
Space / Peril.Description: Choose or roll on this table when you want inspiration for a trouble during spaceborne exploration or on an interstellar expedition.

Table.Result: Automated defenses or mines protect this area
Compartment catches fire or is breached
Contagion or illness threatens to take hold
Dust clouds imperil navigation or conceal foes
Familiar foe appears or sends an ominous message
Gravity well or vortex takes hold
Mysterious wreckage portends a new threat
Onboard dispute or inner turmoil causes a disruption
Others obstruct your path or form a blockade
Phantom signals suggest a lurking foe
True nature of a cargo, occupant, or passenger is revealed

Space / Opportunity.Name: Opportunity
Space / Opportunity.Description: Choose or roll on this table when you want inspiration for a beneficial encounter or event on a spaceborne journey, such as when you roll a strong hit with a match as you [Undertake an Expedition](#Undertake-an-Expedition), or if you [Explore a Waypoint](#Explore-a-Waypoint) and find an opportunity.

Table.Result: Advance warning of an environmental threat
Automated signal offers a helpful message or warning
Chance for fellowship or a moment of inner peace
Clear path through otherwise perilous space
Clue offers insight into a current quest or mystery
Clue to a lifeform's nature or vulnerabilities
Foe inadvertently reveals themselves or tips their hand
Friendly interaction with a benign lifeform
Helpful or encouraging message from an acquaintance
Impressive vista offers comfort or inspiration
Interesting site offers opportunities for exploration
Navigational or environmental hazard is left behind
Opening to escape or avoid foes
Plea for help from a potential benefactor
Probe or beacon with useful data
Refuge offers a place to hide, plan, or recover
Sensors reveal helpful or interesting environmental data
Vehicle or equipment performs beyond expectations

Starship / Name.Name: Name
Starship / Name.Description: Give a starship a name when it has an important role in your story. Scan this table and select a name which fits what you know of the ships appearance and role. Or generate a random result and let any contradictions contribute to the ships history or nature.

Table.Summary: Launches fighters
Light attack ship
Fast transport
Medium attack ship
Heavy attack ship
Survival craft
Mobile construction platform
Fuel or energy excavator
Heavy transport
Stealthy attack ship
Habitat
Utility or repair
Remote survey or research
Command ship
Mineral excavator
Salvage or rescue
Short-range transport
Small attack craft
Starship Mission
